reset().Description: Will reset the @B_android#media#MediaPlayer_E@ and the glue such that a new file can be played. You are not required to call this method before playing the first file. However you have to call it before playing a second one.

Parameters: boolean: True to enable progress updating, false otherwise.
setProgressUpdatingEnabled(boolean).Description: Implement this method to enable or disable progress updating.

isPlaying().Description: Returns true if media is currently playing.

getBufferedPosition().Description: Returns the current buffered position of the media item in milliseconds.

getDuration().Description: Returns the duration of the media item in milliseconds.

getCurrentPosition().Description: Returns the current position of the media item in milliseconds.

Returns: True if the method handled the info, false if it didn't. Returning false, will cause the info to be discarded.
Parameters: int: the type of info or warning. MEDIA_INFO_UNKNOWN MEDIA_INFO_VIDEO_TRACK_LAGGING MEDIA_INFO_VIDEO_RENDERING_START MEDIA_INFO_BUFFERING_START MEDIA_INFO_BUFFERING_END MEDIA_INFO_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH (703) - bandwidth information is available (as extra kbps) MEDIA_INFO_BAD_INTERLEAVING MEDIA_INFO_NOT_SEEKABLE MEDIA_INFO_METADATA_UPDATE MEDIA_INFO_UNSUPPORTED_SUBTITLE MEDIA_INFO_SUBTITLE_TIMED_OUT
int: an extra code, specific to the info. Typically implementation dependent.
onInfo(int, int).Description: Called to indicate an info or a warning.

onDetachedFromHost().Description: This method is called when current associated @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlueHost_E@ is attached to a different @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlue_E@ or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlueHost_E@ is destroyed. Subclass may override. A typical implementation will release resources (e.g. MediaPlayer or connection to playback service) in this method.

release().Description: Release internal MediaPlayer. Should not use the object after call release().

Returns: True if MediaPlayer OnPreparedListener is invoked and got a SurfaceHolder if @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlaybackGlueHost_E@ provides SurfaceHolder.
True if the method handled the error, false if it didn't. Returning false, will cause the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlayerAdapter#Callback#onPlayCompleted_E@ being called.
Parameters: int: the type of error that has occurred: MEDIA_ERROR_UNKNOWN MEDIA_ERROR_SERVER_DIED

int: an extra code, specific to the error. Typically implementation dependent. MEDIA_ERROR_IO MEDIA_ERROR_MALFORMED MEDIA_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED MEDIA_ERROR_TIMED_OUT MEDIA_ERROR_SYSTEM (-2147483648) - low-level system error.

Returns: Returns true if uri represents a new media; false otherwise.
setDataSource(android.net.Uri).Description: Sets the media source of the player witha given URI.

onSeekComplete().Description: Called to indicate the completion of a seek operation.

ClassDesc: This implementation extends the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#media#PlayerAdapter_E@ with a https:##developer#android#com@B_android#media#MediaPlayer_E@.
